DocTemplateDefinition.Name: Type Element Aggregation
DocTemplateDefinition.Documentation: Provision of an aggregation structure (or decomposition tree) of types of physical element, where the _element__type_ is either the whole or one of the parts of an aggregated structure.

DocTemplateDefinition.Name: Type Element Composition
DocTemplateDefinition.Documentation: Provision of an aggregation structure where the _element type_ is part of another element type representing the composite. The _element type_ then provides the partial shape representation map.

DocTemplateDefinition.Name: Type Element Decomposition
DocTemplateDefinition.Documentation: Provision of an aggregation structure where the _element type_, representing the composite, is decomposed into parts represented by other element types. The _element type_ being the composite shall not have an own shape representation map. The shape representation maps are provided by the parts.

DocTemplateDefinition.Name: Type Geometry
DocTemplateDefinition.Documentation: Provision of a common geometry for all occurrences of this "element" type as representation maps.

DocTemplateDefinition.Name: Type Material
DocTemplateDefinition.Documentation: Provision of a common material information for all occurrences of this "element" type. The material information may be provided as a single material, or a material layer set. On import: the <element type=""> material shall be copied to all "element" occurrences, if types are not supported natively.</element>

DocTemplateDefinition.Name: Type Naming
DocTemplateDefinition.Documentation: Provision of basic element attributes for the _element type_. It includes: * _Name_ * _Description_ * _Tag_ * _PredefinedType_(if available at the element entity definition) as , * _ElementType_ being the user defined type, if the _PredefinedType_ is set to USERDEFINED. This information is provided as direct attributes at the _element type_. The default requirement stipulated by this **concept template** is that the provision of a _Name_and of a _PredefinedType_(if available) is mandatory, whereas the provision of a _Description, a Tag_and an Element_Type_is optional. A **model view definitio**n shall clearly define which of those attributes are required to have values, and if there are constraints on those values.

DocTemplateDefinition.Name: Type Property Set
DocTemplateDefinition.Documentation: Provision of a common property set for all occurrences of this "element" type. The property set can be an IFC common property set, any IFC property set applicable to the "element" type, or a user/system defined property set. Those property set names shall not start with "Pset_" prefix (not case sensitive). On import: the <element type=""> property sets shall be copied to all "element" occurrences, if types are not supported natively.</element>
